properties.description: Ashfield Voluntary Action invites you to our Warm Welcome Activity Space. Social Groups run throughout the week and adults are welcome to join us. When the group ends our Warm Welcome doesn't. You can stay until 4pm and make use of the games, puzzles, and crafts or pick up a book and have a quiet read. The hot drinks trolley will be available for you to use. Bring some lunch with you or pop down to our kiosk in the main reception that offers hot and cold food at reasonable prices. For more information about our social groups please call 01623 555 551 or visit our website www.ashfieldvoluntaryaction.org.uk Please note we are unable to offer this service from Friday 22nd December 2023 until Monday 8th January 2024

properties.description: A small group of local people are volunteering and working exceptionally hard to set up a ‘Winter Warm Hub at Jacksdale Community Centre. This is going to be known as ‘The Community Kitchen’. This will be open each Tuesday morning from 11.00 am until 1.00pm, starting on 1st October 2024. The Community Kitchen is a not-for-profit venture and is being supported financially by donations and run by volunteers. ‘Everyone will be made very welcome. The heating will be on, so come along and join us for a light lunch and tea and coffee. Hopefully this small venture will be a huge success over the winter period and a great support to those who need it, right here in our community.

properties.title: The Village Lunch

properties.address: Daybrook Baptist Church, Mansfield Road, Nottingham, NG5 6AA
properties.description: During the cost of living crisis we understand more people need help for essential food, therefore Places for People have donated to various foodbank across the country to help our customers and other individuals in the community. The foodbank provides three days of nutritionally balanced, non-perishable food and are also running a More Than Food programme. This means that they are providing additional support alongside emergency food, to help people address the underlying issues behind their crisis. They have specifically trained volunteers who can offer you additional help in the following areas: Eat Well Spend Less – a six-week basic cookery, nutrition and budget management course.Holiday Club – supporting families at times when free school meals are not available by offering food and fun activities.Money Life – providing tools and courses to tackle debt and budgeting.Fuel Bank – supports households most in need of help by giving them funds to pay for gas and electricity alongside emergency food aid. Over the colder winter months, the Foodbank will also act as a Warm hub, providing a safe place which is warm, friendly and welcoming. They offer a lifeline for people in social isolation and those suffering with fuel poverty. How to get help | Arnold Foodbank

hours._text: Opening times – for referrals and donations.Monday, Wednesday and Friday 1.30pm – 3.00pm

properties.title: Arnold Foodbank & Warm Hub(Nottingham)

properties.address: Church of Christ Riddings, DE55 4EZ
properties.description: Over the colder winter months, we understand that many people face fuel poverty and struggle to afford heating costs. This is why we have funded a number of Warm hubs that can support people during the cost-of-living crisis. Warm hubs provide a safe place which is warm, friendly and welcoming where attendees can partake in social activities surrounded by the company of others whilst receiving support during difficult times. They offer a lifeline for people in social isolation and those suffering with fuel poverty. We also recognise that during the cost of living crisis more people need help for essential food, therefore Places for People have donated to various foodbank across the country to help our customers and other individuals in the community. Oscari warm space provides people with warm drinks, a craft club and friendly faces to chat to. They are also a Foodbank providing essentials to people in the area weekly and in emergencies. Opening times Facebook: www.facebook.com
properties.title: Oscari - Amber Valley

properties.address: The Oliver Hind Youth Club, Edale Road, NG2 4HT
properties.description: Over the colder winter months, we understand that many people face fuel poverty and struggle to afford heating costs. This is why we have funded a number of Warm hubs that can support people during the cost-of-living crisis. Warm hubs provide a safe place which is warm, friendly and welcoming where attendees can partake in social activities surrounded by the company of others whilst receiving support during difficult times. They offer a lifeline for people in social isolation and those suffering with fuel poverty. The EPIC Warm Space is mroe than just a place - it's a community waiting to welcome you. You can access warm drinks, fruit and biscuits whilst making the most of the facilities, such as the football table, table tennis, pool and air hockey. Website: https://www.epicpartners.co.uk/

hours._text: Opening Times: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday 12pm - 2.45pm & Wednesday, Friday 10am - 2.45pm (Term time only)
